This function implements the Sieve of Eratosthenes algorithm to find all primes less than or equal to a given integer n.

First, it creates a list of length n + 1 with all elements set to True indicating they are prime candidates. Then it iterates over all integers from 2 up to the square root of n. For each candidate prime, it marks all multiples of the prime as non-prime by setting them to False. Finally, the function returns all candidates that remained True.

Then, it iterates through the indices from 2 up to square root of num (called end) and marks all divisible indices as False. After that, it iterates over the remaining indices from end + 1 up to num + 1 to mark any prime indices as True. Finally, it returns all the True values from sieve as a list of prime numbers.
